ImageData.LabelName: Cancer has spread to other parts of the body:

OriginalSource.Creator: Terese Winslow
OriginalSource.Comment: Removed the brain anatomy showing through the face
Added a face to the figure, removed the label for Bone, and changed the title of the image to “Stage IV”
Removed Lymph nodes label pointing to the neck area
Changed the label in the inset box to say “Extra fluid around the lung”

In the inset box with the lungs, changed the label to say “Extra fluid around the lungs”; made a single line pointing down to the large yellow area of fluid near the middle/bottom of the right lung (left side of image)
REVISED IMAGE: In the inset, added more fluid around the lungs

REVISED IMAGE per FIGO update: Removed "Ovarian Cancer" from title; deleted the label “Cancer in the ovaries” and also deleted the cancer spots in the ovaries; added lymph nodes in the groin, and labeled them “Lymph nodes in the groin”; made a pull-out that shows cancer in fluid around the lungs.

Diagnoses.Diagnosis: stage IV ovarian germ cell tumor

ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: Drawing of stage IV shows other parts of the body where ovarian cancer may spread, including the lung, liver, and lymph nodes in the groin. An inset on the top shows extra fluid around the lung. An inset on the bottom shows cancer cells spreading through the blood and lymph system to another part of the body where metastatic cancer has formed.

Drawing of stage IV shows other parts of the body where ovarian cancer may spread, including the lung, liver, and lymph nodes in the groin. An inset on the top shows extra fluid around the lung. An inset on the bottom shows cancer cells spreading through the blood and lymph system to another part of the body where metastatic cancer has formed.

Captions.MediaCaption: In stage IV, cancer has spread beyond the abdomen to other parts of the body. In stage IVA, cancer cells are found in extra fluid that builds up around the lungs. In stage IVB, cancer has spread to organs and tissues outside the abdomen, including the lung, liver, and lymph nodes in the groin.

In stage IV, cancer has spread beyond the abdomen to other parts of the body. In stage IVA, cancer cells are found in extra fluid that builds up around the lungs. In stage IVB, cancer has spread to organs and tissues outside the abdomen, including the lung, liver, and lymph nodes in the groin.

ProposedUse.Summary: Ovarian Epithelial, Fallopian Tube, and Primary Peritoneal Cancer Treatment
ProposedUse.Glossary: stage IV ovarian epithelial, fallopian tube, and primary peritoneal cancer
stage IV ovarian germ cell tumor
